extends java.lang.Object
         Class Definition :

      Solution        :       Implements produce(String) and combine(String, String) methods.
      SolutionConfig  :       Configurable Parameters for the program execution.
      FileUtil        :       Operations related to File IO
      LogicUtil       :       Custom logic related to program.


     To change the inputs, make changes in testMainLogic()

    • Method Detail

      • combine

        public static java.lang.String combine(java.lang.String filename1,
                                       java.lang.String filename2)
        merges the output files produced by produce(String) function. 
         Main Logic

 1.   Validate names of the both input files. For Validation Logic, refer LogicUtil.validateFileNameConventions(String, String)

 2.   Find out extraBytesSize from the input to this function.For Logic, refer LogicUtil.getEachPartSizeFromFilename(String, long) (String, String)}

 3.   Find out eachPartSize by from the input to this function. For Logic, refer LogicUtil.getEachPartSizeFromFilename(String, long)

 4.    Merge operation works in three phase.
          a.  read first k parts from first file. First file should be Math.max(firstFileNumber,secondFileNumber)
          b.  read 1 part from another file.
          c.  read all remaining parts including extraBytes from the first file again.

          More detailed logic is explained inside private method.

 5.   Return the merged file name.
        Parameters:
        filename1 - any output filename produced by produce(String)
        filename2 - any output filename produced by produce(String) , but not same as first parameter
        Returns:
        a single file by merging the two input files.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
         This method simply calls the testMainLogic() method, which runs tests for
 produce(String) and combine(String, String) methods.
        Parameters:
        args - argument to the program
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if Junit is unable to get executed.

      • produce

        public static java.lang.String[] produce(java.lang.String filename)
        
 Given input file with name, provide the names of all splitted files.

 Note : This function is adaptable. Set how many files you want as an output at SolutionConfig.NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES.

 Main Logic

 Depending upon requirement,
 In Input we are given one file name.
 1.   Find out Number of bytes in input file. Let's call it n.

 2.   File will be divided in to 3 ( default value of NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES) parts. Size of each part is denoted by eachPartSize.
      and there will be some bytes remaining at the end of file. number of such remaingBytes are denoted by remainingBytesSize.

 3.   Find out eachPartSize = (n / NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES) .

 4.   Find out remainingBytesSize = n % NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES

 5.   All output files of this function are numbered with PartNumber which ranges from 1 to NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES ( including both)
      Name of all these output files will follow a convention. "actualInputFileName_remainingBytesSize_PartNumber".
      Prefix "actualInputFileName_remainingBytesSize_" remains static.
      Suffix "PartNumber" ranges from 1 to NUMBER_OF_OUTPUT_FILES.( including both)
      Separator can be configured at SolutionConfig.OUTPUT_FILE_SPLITTER

 6.   Output File with PartNumber 1 in its name will have all the parts including reaminingBytes at the end, but not the 1st part.
      Output File with PartNumber 2 in its name will have all the parts  including reaminingBytes at the end except 2nd part.
      and so on for all the output files.

 7.   Return name of all the output files by adding each suffix to the given prefix
        Parameters:
        filename - fileName which needs to be splitted
        Returns:
        array of splitted file names.

        public void testMainLogic()
